definitions.definition: Showing symptoms.
Relating to, based on, or constituting a symptom.
definitions.example: The city's problems are symptomatic of the crisis that is spreading throughout the country.

definitions.definition: Relating to symptomatics
(of an installation etc) capable of being defended against armed attack
(of an argument etc) capable of being justified
The process by which a planet is warmed by its atmosphere.
definitions.example: The greenhouse effect could lead to global warming or, at least, climate change.

definitions.definition: Any of several fastenings.
The act or process of holding fast; that which serves to hold fast; a grip or grasp.
definitions.example: to get a good clinch of an antagonist, or of a weapon

definitions.definition: A pun.
A hitch or bend by which a rope is made fast to the ring of an anchor, or the breeching of a ship's gun to the ringbolts.
A passionate embrace.
In combat sports, the act of one or both fighters holding onto the other to prevent being hit or engage in standup grappling.
To clasp; to interlock.
To make certain; to finalize.
definitions.example: I already planned to buy the car, but the color was what really clinched it for me.

definitions.definition: To fasten securely or permanently.
To bend and hammer the point of (a nail) so it cannot be removed.
To embrace passionately.
To hold firmly; to clench.
To set closely together; to close tightly.
definitions.example: to clinch the teeth or the fist

definitions.definition: A small primate, Perodicticus potto, native to the tropical rainforests of Africa.
The kinkajou.
A card or badge showing the official identity of the bearer.
Having light; bright; clear; not dark or obscure.
definitions.example: The room is light when the Sun shines through the window.

definitions.definition: Pale or whitish in color; highly luminous and more or less deficient in chroma.
definitions.example: She had light skin.

definitions.definition: (of coffee) Served with extra milk or cream.
definitions.example: I like my coffee light.

definitions.definition: Having little or relatively little actual weight; not cumbrous or unwieldy.
definitions.example: a light load ; a lighter backpack after having removed the books ; light weapons

definitions.definition: Having little weight as compared with bulk; of little density or specific gravity.
definitions.example: feathers and cork are light ; oil is lighter than water

definitions.definition: Of short or insufficient weight; weighing less than the legal, standard or proper amount; clipped or diminished.
definitions.example: to issue light coin

definitions.definition: Lacking that which burdens or makes heavy.
Not heavy or soggy; spongy; well raised.
definitions.example: a light bread ; sponge cake is a light cake

definitions.definition: Gentle; having little force or momentum.
definitions.example: This artist clearly had a light, flowing touch.

definitions.definition: Easy to endure or perform.
definitions.example: light duties around the house

definitions.definition: Low in fat, calories, alcohol, salt, etc.
definitions.example: This light beer still gets you drunk if you have enough of it.

definitions.definition: Unimportant, trivial, having little value or significance.
definitions.example: I made some light comment, and we moved on.

definitions.definition: Unchaste, wanton.
Not encumbered; unembarrassed; clear of impediments; hence, active; nimble; swift.
Easily influenced by trifling considerations; unsteady; unsettled; volatile.
definitions.example: a light, vain person; a light mind

definitions.definition: Indulging in, or inclined to, levity; lacking dignity or solemnity; frivolous; airy.
definitions.example: Ogden Nash was a writer of light verse.

definitions.definition: Not quite sound or normal; somewhat impaired or deranged; dizzy; giddy.
Easily interrupted by stimulation.
definitions.example: light sleep; light anesthesia

definitions.definition: One who, or that which, lights.
definitions.example: a lighter of lamps

definitions.definition: A small, reusable handheld device for creating fire, especially for lighting cigarettes.
definitions.example: Cigarette in mouth, he clutched his pockets in search of a lighter.

definitions.definition: A flat-bottomed boat for carrying heavy loads across short distances (especially for canals or for loading or unloading larger boats).
To transfer cargo or fuel from a ship, lightening it to make its draft less or to make it easier to refloat.
Having light; bright; clear; not dark or obscure.
definitions.example: The room is light when the Sun shines through the window.

definitions.definition: Pale or whitish in color; highly luminous and more or less deficient in chroma.
definitions.example: She had light skin.

definitions.definition: (of coffee) Served with extra milk or cream.

definitions.definition: Sorrow, grief.
A ring fitted upon the head of a lance to prevent wounding an adversary in tilting.
To express sadness or sorrow for; to grieve over (especially a death).
To utter in a sorrowful manner.
To wear mourning.
A large aquatic rodent (Ondatra zibethicus).
Any of several species of shrews in the family Soricidae, especially the Asian house shrew, Suncus murinus
A westerly wind or storm.
Situated in the west.
(of wind) Coming from the west.
Towards the west.
A piston or a rotary heat engine directly powered by the products of intermittent combustion of a fuel.

A heat engine in which intermittent or the continuous burning of a fuel takes place inside a combustion chamber; the resulting pressurized gas acts directly on the engine to do useful work, such as a piston engine, gas turbine, jet engine or rocket.http//www.google.com/url?sa=t&ct=res&cd=1&url=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.britannica.com%2Feb%2Farticle-9106036%2Finternal-combustion-engine&ei=ZdJqSMCnDo_o0gXitpynDA&usg=AFQjCNE6h_t0H7XJLKnUjudcNQjmgMeUdg&sig2=srdZH3-tM_JIU9y7-Q0H6Q
A tool for felling trees or chopping wood etc. consisting of a heavy head flattened to a blade on one side, and a handle attached to it.
An ancient weapon consisting of a head that has one or two blades and a long handle.
A dismissal or rejection.
definitions.example: His girlfriend/boss/schoolmaster gave him the axe.

definitions.definition: A gigging musician's particular instrument, especially a guitar in rock music or a saxophone in jazz.
A position, interest, or reason in buying and selling stock, often with ulterior motives.
definitions.example: A financial dealer has an axe in a stock that his buyers don't know about, giving him an advantage in making the most profit.

definitions.definition: To fell or chop with an axe.
To lay off, terminate or drastically reduce, especially in a rough or ruthless manner; to cancel.
definitions.example: He got axed in the last round of firings.

definitions.definition: The axle of a wheel.
To furnish with an axle.
To request (information, or an answer to a question).
definitions.example: I asked her age.

definitions.definition: To put forward (a question) to be answered.
definitions.example: to ask a question

definitions.definition: To interrogate or enquire of (a person).
definitions.example: I'm going to ask this lady for directions.

definitions.definition: To request or petition; usually with for.
definitions.example: to ask for a second helping at dinner

definitions.definition: To request permission to do something.
definitions.example: Did you ask to use the car?

definitions.definition: To require, demand, claim, or expect, whether by way of remuneration or return, or as a matter of necessity.
definitions.example: What price are you asking for the house?

definitions.definition: To invite.
definitions.example: Don't ask them to the wedding.

definitions.definition: To publish in church for marriage; said of both the banns and the persons.
To take (a person's situation) as an example.
A pin or fastener for the hair.
A kind of ribozyme; hairpin ribozyme.
A very tight bend in a road.
An elongated v-shaped sign placed underneath a staff to indicate a crescendo
The herb absinthium Artemisia absinthium (grande wormwood); essence of wormwood.
Bitterness; sorrow.
A distilled, highly alcoholic, anise-flavored liquor originally made from grande wormwood, anise, and other herbs.
A moderate yellow green; absinthe green.
Sagebrush.
The seashore, the coast.
The waterfront of a seaside town.
A mine that is placed on land and designed to explode when stepped upon or touched.
To sow (an area) with land mines.
Past fashions or trends.
Of, or relating to, the past, past times, or the way things were.
Affecting things past; retroactive, ex post facto.
A small rocket engine on a larger rocket or spacecraft, designed to slow or reverse its motion.
An exhibition of works from an extended period of an artist's activity.
Something that boosts.
The first stage of a multistage rocket that provides the thrust for liftoff and the initial flight
A motor-generator set used for voltage regulation in direct current electrical power circuits.
Someone who is a fan or supporter of something.
Someone who promotes a town or business
A member of a booster club.
A booster dose.

definitions.definition: A term that serves to amplify or strengthen an utterance, such as "really".
A power-up item.
A package of cards or figurines designed to add to a player's collection.
A thief.
definitions.example: The security guard captured two boosters before they could exit the retail store.

definitions.definition: A decorative scarf made out of feathers.
An act or process of filling up; a replenishment.
One who retrieves something.
A type of gun dog that retrieves game for a hunter.
A tool for retrieving materials from the body after an operation.
Of, relating to, or containing ions
True.
Pleasing; delightful; sweet.
One who, or that which, soothes.
A plastic device that goes into a baby’s mouth, used to calm and quiet the baby.
To soothe.
A transport concept consisting of a conventional prime mover truck pulling two or more trailers.
(now chiefly in technical contexts) A paved surface; a hard covering on the ground.
The paved part of a road or other thoroughfare; the roadway.
A paved footpath, especially at the side of a road.
The interior flooring of a church sanctuary, between the communion rail and the altar.
A person who tends sheep, especially a grazing flock.
Someone who watches over, looks after, or guides somebody.
The pastor of a church; one who guides others in religion.
A swain; a rustic male lover.
To watch over; to guide
For a player to obstruct an opponent from getting to the ball, either when a teammate has it or is going for it, or if the ball is about to bounce through the goal or out of bounds.
A long, relatively straight region of a single colour.
definitions.example: zebra stripes

definitions.definition: (in the plural) The badge worn by certain officers in the military or other forces.
Distinguishing characteristic; sign; likeness; sort.
definitions.example: persons of the same political stripe

definitions.definition: A long, narrow mark left by striking someone with a whip or stick; a blow with a whip or stick.
A pattern produced by arranging the warp threads in sets of alternating colours, or in sets presenting some other contrast of appearance.
Any of the balls marked with stripes in the game of pool, which one player aims to pot, the other player taking the spots.
A portion of data distributed across several separate physical disks for the sake of redundancy.
To mark with stripes.
To lash with a whip or strap.
To distribute data across several separate physical disks to reduce the time to read and write.
A home in which the parents have separated or divorced.
Friendly and cheerful.
(especially of weather) Pleasantly mild and warm.
Marked by genius.
Contributing to, or concerned in, propagation or production; generative; procreative; productive.
Belonging to one's genius or natural character; native; natural; inborn.
Relating to the chin; genian.
The state or quality of being underweight.
An underweight person.
To underestimate the weight of.
To give insufficient weight to (a consideration); to underestimate the importance of.
Of an inappropriately or unusually low weight.
definitions.example: He's so underweight he's had to buy smaller clothes.

definitions.definition: Not too heavy for an intended purpose.
definitions.example: The suitcase is just slightly underweight; I'll let it on the plane.

definitions.definition: Being less invested in a particular area than market wisdom suggests.
definitions.example: The fund is underweight in mining.

definitions.definition: (fabrication) To dye woolen fibers before they are spun into thread.
(of textiles) Dyed before being formed into cloth.
Firmly established in a person's beliefs or habits; deeply ingrained in the nature of a person or thing.
definitions.example: John Major was described by his opponents as a dyed-in-the-wool Conservative.

definitions.definition: A popular hairstyle in the mid-to-late 16th century, nowadays common with poodles.
Of hair or clothing, full-bodied or puffy; puffed out away from head or body.
definitions.example: Her bouffant suit made her seem much heavier than her petite figure actually was.

definitions.definition: A base frame, or movable railway, along which the carriage of a mounted gun moves backward and forward.
The base frame of a motor vehicle.
A frame or housing containing electrical or mechanical equipment, such as on a computer.
A woman's buttocks.
A vote held by a swing voter, and as such unpredictable.
A component frequency of the signal of a wave that is an integer multiple of the fundamental frequency.

One of a class of functions that enter into the development of the potential of a nearly spherical mass due to its attraction.
One's child.
Pertaining to harmony
Pleasant to hear; harmonious; melodious
Used to characterize various mathematical entities or relationships supposed to bear some resemblance to musical consonance
definitions.example: The harmonic polar line of an inflection point of a cubic curve is the component of the polar conic other than the tangent line.

definitions.definition: Recurring periodically
Exhibiting or applying constraints on what vowels (e.g. front/back vowels only) may be found near each other and sometimes in the entire word.
Of or relating to a generation an even number of generations distant from a particular person.

A bassoon-like medieval instrument
A large liquor container made of leather, in the form of a jug or a bottle.
A bombardment.
A bombardon.

To attack something or someone by directing objects at them.
To direct at a substance an intense stream of high-energy particles, usually sub-atomic or made of at most a few atoms.
Hideous or frightful.
Enormously large.

definitions.definition: Freakish or grotesque.

Marvellous; strange.

The act or process of absorbing or of being absorbed as,
Entire engrossment or occupation of the mind.

definitions.definition: Mental assimilation.
The retaining of electrical energy for a short time after it has been introduced to the dielectric.
A goal scored by kicking the ball through the goal from open play, after the ball has touched the ground.
A fundraising event with raffles, cake sales, bingo etc; usually run by churches and schools.
A deviant; a person who is hostile or destructive to society.
A person who fought for Charles I in the English Civil War.
Harmful, malevolent, injurious.

definitions.definition: Tending to produce death; threatening a fatal issue.

A single atom of this element.

The energy possessed by an object because of its position (in a gravitational or electric field), or its condition (as a stretched or compressed spring, as a chemical reactant, or by having rest mass).
In an acceptable manner; in a manner to please or give satisfaction.
To an acceptable degree.
A colourless liquid, H2O2, soluble in water, used as a mild antiseptic, bleaching agent (especially for bleaching hair), oxidizing agent and chemical reagent.
A tadpole.
The body of diplomats and foreign policy officers maintained by the government of a country to communicate with the governments of other countries.
To cause unease; to annoy, irritate.
To infect with a disease.
Affected with or suffering from disease.
Meats such as beef that are dark red in colour when uncooked.
Fresh, inspiring, or inflammatory topics or information.
To work against; to oppose (especially to incite reaction)
definitions.example: The other children constantly antagonized Joe to the point of tears.

definitions.definition: A unit of fineness or concentration of gold equalling 1/24 part of gold in an alloy.
The act of joining, or condition of being joined.
(grammar) A word used to join other words or phrases together into sentences. The specific conjunction used shows how the two joined parts are related.

An aspect in which planets are in close proximity to one another.
The proposition resulting from the combination of two or more propositions using the ∧ (\and) operator.
Sexual intercourse.

Someone who has previously been a master at a given lodge.
One who has an extremely high level of ability or knowledge within an area of achievement or expertise.
Unspoiled; still with its original purity; uncorrupted or unsullied.
Primitive, pertaining to the earliest state of something.
Perfect.
Relating to sawfishes of the family Pristidae.
To make, transport and/or sell illegal alcoholic liquor.
To make, transport and/or sell an illegal version or copy of a copyrighted product.
To engage in bootlegging.
Any snake.
A name loosely applied to various snakes more or less resembling the viper; a viper.
Someone who or something which performs arithmetic addition; a machine for adding numbers.
An electronic device that adds voltages, currents or frequencies.
Something which adds or increases.

Slender and long of limb; lanky

Anything precious or valuable.

To attach with nails
